WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office.
Washington, November 1, 1902.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to request that Major Walter Reed,
surgeon, U. S. Army, may be ordered to proceed to Fort H.G.
Wright, Fisher's Island, New York, to investigate and re-
port upon the epidemic of typhoid fever among the troops
quartered there during the recent maneuvers in that vicinity,
and upon completion of this duty to return to his proper
station in this city.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, R.M. O'Reilly Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
